title: Qt: NoDigestError: Attempt to check URLFetchStrategy with no digest
body:
Trying to install Qt and came across
```
==> Trying to fetch from http://download.qt.io/archive/qt/5.7/5.7.0/single/qt-everywhere-opensource-src-5.7.0.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Error: NoDigestError: Attempt to check URLFetchStrategy with no digest.
/Users/davydden/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:958, in do_fetch:
     926      def do_fetch(self, mirror_only=False):
     927          """
     928          Creates a stage directory and downloads the tarball for this package.
     929          Working directory will be set to the stage directory.
     930          """
     931          if not self.spec.concrete:
     932              raise ValueError("Can only fetch concrete packages.")
     933
     934          start_time = time.time()
     935          if spack.do_checksum and self.version not in self.versions:
     936              tty.warn("There is no checksum on file to fetch %s safely." %
     937                       self.spec.format('$_$@'))
     938
     939              # Ask the user whether to skip the checksum if we're
     940              # interactive, but just fail if non-interactive.
     941              ck_msg = "Add a checksum or use --no-checksum to skip this check."
     942              ignore_checksum = False
     943              if sys.stdout.isatty():
     944                  ignore_checksum = tty.get_yes_or_no("  Fetch anyway?",
     945                                                      default=False)
     946                  if ignore_checksum:
     947                      tty.msg("Fetching with no checksum.", ck_msg)
     948
     949              if not ignore_checksum:
     950                  raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
     951                                   self.spec.format('$_$@'), ck_msg)
     952
     953          self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
     954
     955          self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
     956
     957          if spack.do_checksum and self.version in self.versions:
  >> 958              self.stage.check()
     959
     960          self.stage.cache_local()
```
